page.title: 15Steyning History
page.content: Steyning is an old town dating back to Saxon times.Where St.Andrews church stands was an old wooden one built by Cuthman before{1066.}The present one was built by the Normans in the{12thC. It has beautiful arches and lovely organ pipes.There are houses of all times in history.A brick and timber gabled prison or stone house is thought to be early{14thC.}One of the oldest is the Chequer Inn, believed to be early{15thC.}and a famous coaching house. The Saxon Cottage is probably {16thC.}and is made completely without nails,with a thickly thatched catslide roof almost to the ground. Brotherhood hall is a{15thC.}tile hung house, now The Grammar School. Opposite is the Norfolk Arms which in the{17thC.}was a private house. This house has a Jacobean staircase hand carved and in perfect condition.
